verses.roman:
tumita yavana hañā kene anukṣaṇa
hindura devatāra nāma laha ki kāraṇa

synonyms: tumita—but you; yavana—meat-eaters; hañā—being; kene—why; anukṣaṇa—always; hindura—of the Hindus; devatāra—of the God; nāma—the name; laha—you take; ki—what; kāraṇa—the reason.
translation: " 'The Hindus chant the name Hari because that is the name of their God. But you are Muslim meat-eaters. Why do you chant the name of the Hindus' God?'
